result.execSummary:
All charges against Shelton L. Sherrod in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shelton L. Sherrod is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Attorney Kristyne Watson in court for Shelton L. Sherrod. Defendant Shelton L. Sherrod in court. Clerk. M.Burke. On state's motion this case is dismissed. Bond applied to 21CM725, any remainder to be returned to poster.

NO RECORD MADE. State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney Kristyne Watson in court for Shelton L. Sherrod who does not appear.Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Watson advises that she spoke with the DE about the plea but does not think she advised him of the new court date.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
At the request of Attorney Watson a PLEAH has been set to 09/19/22 at 3:30. the FP of 10/03/22 and 10/10/22 have been taken off the calendar.
